verses.kjv: Then David said, This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.
verses.web: Then David said, “This is the house of LORD God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
verses.ct: Then David declared, "This is where the house of the LORD God will stand, and this is where the altar of burnt offering for Israel will be."

verses.kjv: And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
verses.web: David gave orders to gather together the foreigners who were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to cut dressed stones to build God’s house.
verses.ct: David ordered that all the foreigners living in the land of Israel be gathered together, and he assigned stonemasons to cut and shape stones for building the house of God.

verses.kjv: And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the joinings; and brass in abundance without weight;
verses.web: David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the couplings; and bronze in abundance without weight;
verses.ct: David stockpiled huge quantities of iron for the nails, gate doors, and fittings, along with more bronze than anyone could weigh.

verses.kjv: Also cedar trees in abundance: for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
verses.web: and cedar trees without number, for the Sidonians and the people of Tyre brought cedar trees in abundance to David.
verses.ct: He also gathered cedar logs beyond counting, because the people of Sidon and Tyre had brought enormous amounts of cedar wood to David.

verses.kjv: And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the LORD must be exceeding magnifical, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
verses.web: David said, “Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be built for LORD must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries. I will therefore make preparation for it.” So David prepared abundantly before his death.
verses.ct: David said to himself, "My son Solomon is still young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be extraordinarily magnificent — famous and glorious in every nation on earth. So I'll get everything ready for him now." With that, David made massive preparations before his death.

verses.kjv: Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build an house for the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: Then he called for Solomon his son, and commanded him to build a house for LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.

verses.kjv: And David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God:
verses.web: David said to Solomon his son, “As for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of LORD my God.
verses.ct: David said to Solomon, "My son, it was my deepest desire to build a house for the name of the LORD my God.

verses.kjv: But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build an house unto my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
verses.web: But LORD’s word came to me, saying, ‘You have shed blood abundantly, and have made great wars. You shall not build a house to my name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.
verses.ct: But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, 'You have shed too much blood and fought too many wars. You will not build a house for my name, because you have spilled so much blood on the earth while I watched.

verses.kjv: Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
verses.web: Behold, a son shall be born to you, who shall be a man of peace. I will give him rest from all his enemies all around; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.
verses.ct: But listen — a son will be born to you who will be a man of peace. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side. His name will be Solomon, and during his reign I will give Israel peace and quiet.

verses.kjv: He shall build an house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
verses.web: He shall build a house for my name; and he will be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
verses.ct: He is the one who will build a house for my name. He will be my son, and I will be his father, and I will establish his royal throne over Israel forever.'

verses.kjv: Now, my son, the LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the LORD thy God, as he hath said of thee.
verses.web: Now, my son, may LORD be with you and prosper you, and build the house of LORD your God, as he has spoken concerning you.
verses.ct: Now, my son, may the LORD be with you. May you succeed and build the house of the LORD your God, just as he promised you would.

verses.kjv: Only the LORD give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the LORD thy God.
verses.web: May LORD give you discretion and understanding, and put you in charge of Israel; that so you may keep the law of LORD your God.
verses.ct: Above all, may the LORD give you wisdom and understanding when he puts you in charge of Israel, so that you can follow the law of the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil the statutes and judgments which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
verses.web: Then you will prosper, if you observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which LORD gave Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid, and don’t be dismayed.
verses.ct: You will succeed if you carefully obey the statutes and ordinances that the LORD gave Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Don't be afraid, and don't lose heart.

verses.kjv: Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD an hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto.
verses.web: Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for LORD’s house one hundred thousand talents of gold, one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron without weight; for it is in abundance. I have also prepared timber and stone; and you may add to them.
verses.ct: Through years of hard work, I've set aside 100,000 talents of gold and 1,000,000 talents of silver for the LORD's house, along with bronze and iron too vast to measure. I've also prepared timber and stone — and you can add even more to what I've gathered.

verses.kjv: Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men for every manner of work.
verses.web: There are also workmen with you in abundance, cutters and workers of stone and timber, and all kinds of men who are skillful in every kind of work;
verses.ct: You have plenty of workers available to you — stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and every kind of skilled craftsman for every kind of work.

verses.kjv: Of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and be doing, and the LORD be with thee.
verses.web: of the gold, the silver, the bronze, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and may LORD be with you.”
verses.ct: The gold, silver, bronze, and iron are beyond counting. So get up and get to work, and may the LORD be with you."

verses.kjv: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
verses.web: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
verses.ct: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to support his son Solomon, saying,

verses.kjv: Is not the LORD your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given the inhabitants of the land into mine hand; and the land is subdued before the LORD, and before his people.
verses.web: “Isn’t LORD your God with you? Hasn’t he given you rest on every side? For he has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand; and the land is subdued before LORD, and before his people.
verses.ct: "Isn't the LORD your God with you? Hasn't he given you peace on every side? He handed the people of this land over to me, and the land has been brought under the control of the LORD and his people.

verses.kjv: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of the LORD.
verses.web: Now set your heart and your soul to follow LORD your God. Arise therefore, and build the sanctuary of LORD God, to bring the ark of LORD’s covenant and the holy vessels of God into the house that is to be built for LORD’s name.”
verses.ct: Now commit yourselves — heart and soul — to seeking the LORD your God. Get up and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that the ark of the covenant of the LORD and all the holy vessels of God can be brought into the house built for the name of the LORD."
